publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

monogr.title: A sermon preached before his Maiesty at Windsore, the 19. of Iuly. 1625. By Henrie Leslie, one of his Maiesties chaplaines in ordinary
monogr.author: Leslie, Henry

div.head: TO THE RIGHT HONOVRABLE IAMES.
div.p: EARLE OF CARLILE, 〈◊〉 OF DONCASTER, BARON OF SALEY, one of his Majesties most honorable Privy Councell, & Knight of the most Noble Order of the Garter.

RIght Honourable, and my singular good Lord, when I preached this Sermon, I applyed my selfe to this time of affliction, studying more to
profite, then please: yet it did receiue a greater approbation from all, than any thing could deserue that proceeded from my weakenesse. And your Honour was pleased to demaund a Copie of it, which I here humbly present vnto You, in a poore and plaine stile as it was preached, beseeching your Lordship to take in good part this small offering, from him who shall alwayes pray for Your Honours prosperitie in this life, and happines hereafter.

closer.signed: Your Honours in all dutie Henrie Leslie.
